content.description: A paint manufacturer conducted an experiment to investigate whether a new formula produces paint that lasts longer on the exterior of a building than paint produced using an older formula. A grid of <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> squares was drawn on one side of an exterior wall of a building. The new formula was randomly assigned to <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> squares, and the older formula was assigned to the remaining <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> squares. Each square was painted with the assigned formula. One year later, each square was rated on how well the paint had lasted, using a numerical scale for which larger values indicated longer-lasting paint.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the design of the experiment?

choices.label: A completely randomized design, because the two formulas were compared.
A completely randomized design, because each formula was randomly assigned to <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> squares.
A matched pairs design, because the same number of squares were assigned to each formula.
A matched pairs design, because two formulas were compared.
A randomized block design, because the wall was partitioned into <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> squares.

content.answer: A completely randomized design, because each formula was randomly assigned to <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> squares.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
